meanings.sent1: The woosh of the wind through the trees was calming.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud woosh as the car sped by.
meanings.sent3: The woosh of the waterfall drowned out all other noises.
meanings.sent4: The woosh of the rocket taking off was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The sudden woosh of the door closing made me jump.

meanings.definition: To move quickly with a rushing sound.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster wooshed down the track at high speed.
meanings.sent2: I watched the leaves woosh past as the wind blew.
meanings.sent3: The superhero wooshed through the air to save the day.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to woosh by as we were having fun.
meanings.sent5: The train wooshed into the station right on time.

meanings.sent1: The bird wooshed past my window in a flash.
meanings.sent2: I felt the air woosh by as the car zoomed past me.
meanings.sent3: The magician wooshed the cards in a mesmerizing trick.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory wooshed through the crowd.
meanings.sent5: Time wooshed away as we enjoyed the beautiful sunset.
